intro: Lepidagathis vulpina var. vulpina, commonly known as the foxglove lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color, arranged in spikes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the family Rubiaceae.
